title: GCF of Terms
text: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.
speech: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.
pacedSpeech: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.

title: Factor into Primes
speech: Factor  12 x  and  60  into primes.\n 12 x is equal to 2 times 2 times 3 x \n 60 is equal to, 2 times 2 times 3 times 5
pacedSpeech: into primes.  12 x is equal to 2 times 2 times 3 x
60 is equal to, 2 times 2 times 3 times 5

title: Multiply Common Factors
text: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.\n$$GCF=2\times2\times3$$\n$$GCF=12$$
speech: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.\n   g   c   f is equal to 2 times 2 times 3, \n,   g   c   f is equal to 12
pacedSpeech: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.    g   c   f is equal to 2 times 2 times 3,
,   g   c   f is equal to 12

title: Write each Term as a Product using GCF
text: Rewrite $$12x$$ and $$60$$ as products of their GCF, $$12$$.\n$$12x-60$$\n$$12x-12\times5$$
speech: Rewrite  12 x  and  60  as products of their GCF,  12 .\n 12 x minus, 60 \n 12 x, minus 12 times 5

title: Reverse Distributive Property
text: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.\n$$12\left(x-5\right)$$
speech: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.\n 12 times, parentheses x minus 5,
pacedSpeech: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.  12 times,  x minus 5,
